Title.evidence: The Pragmatic Ischaemic Thrombectomy Evaluation (PISTE) trial was a multicentre, randomised, controlled clinical trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Ten UK centres enrolled 65 patients between April 2013 and April 2015.

Participants.evidence: Eligible patients had IVT started within 4.5 hours of stroke symptom onset.

Intervention.evidence: comparing intravenous thrombolysis (IVT) alone with IVT and adjunctive intra-arterial mechanical thrombectomy (MT)

Objective.evidence: Objective: The Pragmatic Ischaemic Thrombectomy Evaluation (PISTE) trial was a multicentre, randomised, controlled clinical trial

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients achieving independence defined by a modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 0–2 at day 90.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ten UK centres enrolled 65 patients between April 2013 and April 2015.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, there was no significant difference in disability-free survival at day 90 with MT

Result_Outcome.evidence: absolute difference 11%, adjusted OR 2.12, 95% CI 0.65 to 6.94, p=0.20
